Despite the admin’s efforts to undermine the #ACA, it is working: 750k Washingtonians gained insurance coverage, 3M+ people w/pre-existing conditions no longer live in fear of being denied health coverage & nearly 72k seniors have saved a cumulative $76M on prescription drugs

I voted twice in the last two weeks to ensure Washingtonians continue to have access to affordable, high-quality health care. These bills will lower prescription drug costs and reverse the administration’s efforts to sabotage the Affordable Care Act. #ProtectOurCare

Yesterday, I voted to support tribal sovereignty, economies and self-determination. Tribes can build a solid foundation for economic growth and preserve important community services for members when lands are put into federal trust.

Today’s hearing comes at the beginning of the Committee’s investigative process and is the first in what will likely be a series of hearings on the 737 MAX. The Committee will not hesitate to act to ensure the safety of the U.S. aviation system.

The FAA has a credibility problem. The FAA needs to fix its credibility problem. This Committee will work with the FAA as it rebuilds public and international confidence in its decisions, but our job is oversight and the Committee will continue to take this role seriously.
During today’s @TransportDems hearing, I look forward to hearing more about the FAA’s certification process, the ODA process & the agency’s role in determining risk assessments for key features.

346 people died in the Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 crash & the Lion Air Flight 610 crash. Congress has an obligation to the traveling public & the victims of these accidents & their families to ensure the safety of air travel. @TransportDems

I have long believed the best way to provide universal health care is to protect the #ACA & expand coverage by adding a public option to drive marketplace competition. I will continue to fight in Congress for environmental sustainability and to maintain the vitality of the Pacific Northwest’s wildlife, wilderness areas and green spaces for the use and enjoyment of current and future generations. #ClimateActionNow #ActOnClimate

Today I voted for #HR9 b/c Congress must take concrete steps to address the threats of #ClimateChange. Withdrawing the US from the Paris Agreement was a grave mistake. Only way to make meaningful progress mitigating the effects of climate change is for countries to work together
